name: Norway
startIntroPart1: Ragnar Lodbrok, a legendary viking leader during the viking ages that has lead the petty kingdoms of Norway into prosperity, and caused great chaos to those unfortunate enough to be victim of your vikingry. Oh Ragnar, the world has changed so much and now we require your great strength once again, will you guide us into prosperity once more in the cold winters of scandinavia? Can you successfuly strike fear into the hearts of your enemies? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: We have landed on their shores! Strike fear into their hearts! RAHHH!!
attacked: We will warm ourselves with the skin of your soldiers.
defeated: Urk... You have defeated me... I applaud you for your skills.
introduction: Friend or foe? You wouldn't want to be the latter!
tradeRequest: Us vikings try to be self sufficient, but it doesn't hurt to have some trade!
uniques: No movement cost to pillage <for [All] units>

name: Mali
startIntroPart1: Kanku Musa, Mansa of the Mali Empire, your wealth has impressed those even in the modern age as you are debatably the wealthiest man to ever exist, your taxxing of gold and salt production over many other kingdoms and your trades of luxuries has secured peace and prosperity for your mighty and rich empire. Oh our great Mansa, will you return to your golden throne to lead our civilization back into prosperty? Can you claim back your title as wealthiest man to ever live? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You stand no chance against us, prepare to die!
attacked: You must be after our gold! My soldiers, kill them!
defeated: I suppose the elders were correct... Money can not save you from everything...
introduction: Greetings, do you want some gold?
tradeRequest: My immense wealth has allowed us to offer you this generous trade!

name: The Holy Romans
startIntroPart1: Otto the Great, king of Italy, Germany and Saxony, a great military commander who have managed to ressurect the Holy Roman Empire and claimed title as the successor of Charlemagne and the Carolingian Empire. Oh Otto, the world now needs your military greatness once more. Can you create a great catholic nation once more? Can you lead this civilization into lasting dominance in history? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: The will of God is on our side! Surrender now!
attacked: You are a spawn of the devil! My crusaders will vanquish you!
defeated: God! I have failed you...
introduction: Praise the lord, fellow man.
tradeRequest: May this trade bless both of our nations into prosperity.

name: The Western Romans
startIntroPart1: Valentinian III of the Western Roman Empire, your reign over the empire was one of the longest, but it was filled with great perils and challenges. Even then so, you managed to stand your ground, while you lost many land to the hispanic conquest in the west, you still managed to defeat the hunnic invaders. Oh Valentinian III, the world needs a ruler of your integrity and endurance once more. Can you survive the harsh battles ahead? Can you repel and defeat all invaders who have come for your throne? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: My mercy is limited, you shall be vanquished!
attacked: Barbaric monster! I'll crush you like the ant you are!
defeated: I... I'm sorry... Aetius...
introduction: Greetings from Rome, friend.
tradeRequest: We shall share our goods to make sure we both prosper.
uniques: Enemy [Wounded] units must spend [1] extra movement points when inside your territory

name: Wales
startIntroPart1: Owain Gwynedd, the self-proclaimed Prince of Wales and true King of Powys, you captured many lands east pushing into the territories of the large nation of England. You gained many victories in the wars you've been waged against and ended up above your contemporaries, your kingdom needs you once more, oh great Owain. Can you withstand the pressure from foreign forces once more? Can you withstand the perils of the world? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your lands are very plenty, I will be taking them.
attacked: This is not my first time on the battlefield, don't underestimate me!
defeated: I have lost, I surrender my kingdom to you, oh mighty ruler.
introduction: I say hello to you, stranger.
tradeRequest: My kingdom offers you this trade deal, it shall be best for you to accept.
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Culture]
Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [+15]% less than normal

name: Switzerland
startIntroPart1: Henry Dunant, Swiss Humanitarian, businessman, and co-founder of the red cross, your humanitarian efforts won you the first noble peace prize in 1901. Your kindness is unmatched as seen from your efforts within the early days of the red cross, but you managed to endure and became a hero to many. Oh, Mr. Dunant, we need your kindness in our world once more. Can you safe the lives of many once more? Can you become the paragon of good to the eyes of many once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I am sorry... This is for the greater good!
attacked: I understand... Come at me if it makes you feel better.
defeated: Have mercy and atleast let me continue my efforts... Please...
introduction: Hello, do you require any assistance?
tradeRequest: This exchange will benefit us both.
uniques: All newly-trained [Melee] units [in all cities] receive the [Medic] promotion
[+33]% Production when constructing [Food] buildings [in all cities]

name: Aragon
startIntroPart1: Oh, James II... King of Aragon, Valencia, Sardinia and Corsica, along with the Count of Barcelona, you conquered the lands of Sardinia in 1324, and created another kingdom to put into your collection. The world needs you once more, Can you conquer your enemies again? Can you create multiple large prosperous kingdoms? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Another kingdom to my collection!
attacked: You will pay!
defeated: Nooo!! I... I have failed...
introduction: Hello there, are you interested in becoming a vassal?
tradeRequest: My vast realm has offered you this exchange!

name: Kushan
startIntroPart1: Kanishka I, the emperor of the Kushan Empire at its zenith, famous for your military, diplomatic, and spiritual advancements, your patronage of buddhist religions was a major part of the creation of the silk road. Oh, great Kanisha I, we the world once again needs your skills once more. Can you once again swiftly defeat your enemies? Can you once again diplomatically charm your contemporaries?  Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are in the way of my ambitions! Begone!
attacked: You are a fool, and will be remembered in history as such!
defeated: My empire! Nooo!!
introduction: Greetings, are you a friend, or a foe?
tradeRequest: I patronize you to accept this trade.
uniques: [+2 Faith, +3 Culture] [in all cities] <when not at war> <starting from the [Classical era]>
Gain [100] [Gold] <upon conquering a city> <starting from the [Classical era]>
Gain [200] [Faith] <upon conquering a city> <starting from the [Classical era]>
Gain [150] [Culture] <upon conquering a city> <starting from the [Classical era]>

name: The Vandals
startIntroPart1: Gaiseric of the Vandal Kingdom, when Valentinian III was murdered and the next emperor cancelled the marriage between your child and theirs, you invaded Italy and commited the great act of the Sacking of Rome. You made many conquests in northern africa and turned a small germanic tribe into a large mediterranian power. Gaiseric, can you repeat your great conquests once more? Can you strike deep into the hearts of your enemies? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You wish to have seen this coming!
attacked: Foolish!
defeated: You have defeated me, but know that you will defeated too.
introduction: I greet you, stranger.
tradeRequest: May I offer you this trade?
uniques: Units in cities cost no Maintenance

name: The Pirate Republic
startIntroPart1: Edward Teach, better known as Blackbeard, you are a vicious and one of the most well known pirates of all time, being the final ruler of the Pirate Republic. You plundered many ships, leaving fear within the hearts of many merchants and sailors alike. Oh, Blackbeard, can you once again terrorize the sea with your terrifying strength? Can you plunder the cities of the foes who dare to oppose you? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Zehahahaha! Get em' boys!
attacked: You'll never take me alive!
defeated: You will regret this! I have associates everywhere!
introduction: Zehahaha! Hello there!
tradeRequest: These goods may or may not have been stolen.
uniques: All newly-trained [Water] units [in all cities] receive the [Pirate] promotion
No movement cost to pillage <for [Water] units>

name: Frisia
startIntroPart1: Pier Gerlofs Donia, you are a peasant leader of a revolt. You owned a farm which was destroyed with many of your kin killed by the Habsburg Authorities, you gathered many disgrunted citizens and petty nobles and launched a revolt! Can you rise up against those stronger than you? Can you destroy those who dare hurt your kin? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your lands will be put into good use, do not worry.
attacked: Ah... I assure you that your greed will be your downfall.
defeated: Heh... You have won, I applaud you for your victory.
introduction: Salutations, I am Pier Gerlofs Donia.
hateHello: It would be best for you to leave.
tradeRequest: May this trade bring prosperity to our nation.
uniques: [+1 Gold] from every [Pasture] <starting from the [Classical era]>
[+1 Food] from every [Pasture] <starting from the [Classical era]>
[+2 Gold] <in cities connected to the capital> <when not at war> <starting from the [Classical era]>

name: Guarani
startIntroPart1: Sepe Tiaraju of the Guarani People, you are a hero and saint of the Guarani people, you led the fight against the Portuguese and Spanish colonial powers in the 18th century earning you the title of 'Servant of God'. Oh Sepe Tiaraju, the world once again needs you, can you use your great military prowess to change the world? Can fight off threats in the name of your people and god as you have before? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are occupying our lands, and we are taking them back!
attacked: Colonizer scum! The devil shall reap your soul!
defeated: I faught hard... I know that my attempts are not futile, and that you will soon fall yourself.
introduction: Hello, I am Sepe Tiaraju, pleased to meet you.
tradeRequest: I offer you this exchange.
uniques: [-25]% Faith cost of generating Great Prophet equivalents
[+3 Faith, +3 Production, +3 Culture] from [Holy Site] tiles [in all cities]

name: Tibet
startIntroPart1: Songtsan Gampo, the 33rd king and first emperor of the great Tibetan Empire, you formally let buddhism into your empire, you unified many tibetan kingdoms and expanded your lands vastly. Oh great Songtsen Gampo, the world needs your military and stewardship expertise once more. Can you expand your great empire into greatness? Can you unite cities of others into one once more? you are Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: It is time to expand my empire, do not resist.
attacked: You are making a fatal mistake!
defeated: I faught hard to build my empire, and you destroyed it... Why?
introduction: Greetings outsider, I am Songtsan Gampo, emperor of the Tibetan Empire.
tradeRequest: Trading brings prosperity to all lands.
uniques: Empire enters golden age <upon conquering a city>

name: Funan
startIntroPart1: Great Queen Soma, you are the first monarch of the Funan State. You were first a pirate which attacked an indian merchant ship, there you found Kaundinya, a man who faught greatly which impressed you with his bravery, you married him and ended up creating one of the most concrete dynasties within south east asian history and created the Funan State. Oh great Queen Soma, the world once again needs your greatness. Can you create an empire to surpass yours? Can you vanquish those in your way? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Hu hu hu... It is time for you to die!
attacked: Hmph! Your arrogance shall be paid in blood!
defeated: I bravely faught for my nation, and that is all that matters.
introduction: I greet you, stranger. I am Queen Soma of the Funan State.
hateHello: To come here after what you've done takes bravery, I applaud you of that, atleast.
tradeRequest: I offer these for that!
uniques: Militaristic City-States grant units [2] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
[+1 Gold, +1 Production, +1 Food] from [Mountain] tiles [in all cities]
[+1 Gold, +1 Production, +1 Food, +1 Culture] from [Mountain] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: The Nabataeans
startIntroPart1: Aretas, King of the Nabataeans, Friend of his People, your rule was the zenith of the Nabataean civilization as your capital, Petra was one of the largest economical hubs and cities in the world at that time. Art and culture flourished while under your rule, and the culture that has grown during your rule is still being felt till today. Can you once again strike the world in awe with your culture? Can you create an economy that can eclipse your last achievements? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Apologies, friend. But you must die!
attacked: Darn you!
defeated: You will be cursed for eternity for what you've done! You will pay!
introduction: I am Aretas IV, friend of his people.
hateHello: If I knew magic, I would've cursed you by now.
tradeRequest: Shall we trade our wealth?
uniques: [+2 Culture] <in cities connected to the capital> <starting from the [Medieval era]>
[+1 Production] from [Desert] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Lithuania
startIntroPart1: Vytautas the Great, Grand Duke of Lithuania, your people have thrived in the dense forests and vast marshlands of Eastern Europe. You defended against the Teutonic Order, Mongols, and Polish forces and even managed to expand your lands, your diplomatic skills formed great bonds with your neighbours. Oh, Vytautas the great, can you turn Lithuania into great state once more? Can you extinguish any attempts to destroy your mighty civilization? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Death awaits you!
attacked: What the hell?!
defeated: My allies will destroy you, monster!
introduction: Let me introduce myself, Vytautas the Great.
tradeRequest: My generous trade should tickle your fancy.

name: Saxony
startIntroPart1: Widukind the Great, ruler of the Saxons during the attacks of Charlemagne. Your efforts to resist the christian forces and the wrath of Charlemagne is remarkable, whilst your nation eventually fell to the greater and more well equipped Frankish forces, your efforts to defend the old faith has not gone unnoticed. Oh Widukind, can you once again reject the unworthy faith of others? Can you defend your great homeland from foreign invaders once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: For Odin!
attacked: Demon! Thor shall smite you!
defeated: You were right... The old gods are too weak...
introduction: I am Widukind of the Saxons, and you are?
tradeRequest: Interested in some barter?

name: The Sea People
startIntroPart1: Sisera, a commander of the Canaanite army of King Jabin of Hazor, who is mentioned in Judges 4–5 of the Hebrew Bible. After being defeated by the forces of the Israelite tribes of Zebulun and Naphtali under the command of Barak and Deborah, you were killed. You were tied to the Sea People by your ancestry and is thus chosen as their ruler. Can you wreak havoc upon greater nations once more? Can you sail the seas for greater conquest? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Face our wrath!
attacked: Good luck with that!
defeated: No! Noo!
introduction: Call me Sisera, of the Sea People.
hateHello: Do you have a death wish?!
tradeRequest: Offering you this trade is generous enough already.

name: Bulgaria
startIntroPart1: Tsar Simeon I of the First Bulgarian Empire. You ruled over Bulgaria from 893 to 927 where you lead successful campaigns against the Byzantines, Magyars and Serbs led Bulgaria to its greatest territorial expansion, making it the most powerful state in contemporary Eastern and Southeast Europe. Oh, Simeon I the Great, can you lead your civilization into its golden age once more? Can you gain cultural dominance over all your contemporaries? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: It is time for you to join us.
attacked: You will regret this decision for the rest of your lives.
defeated: Son of a- Ngh... Well played.
introduction: I am Simeon I of Bulgaria, nice to meet you.
tradeRequest: I shall offer you this fine trade.

name: Scotland
startIntroPart1: Sir William Wallace, knight of the Kingdom of Scotland and soon one of its great leaders during the first war of scottish independence. You defeated an English army at the Battle of Stirling Bridge, then you were appointed Guardian of Scotland and served until your defeat at the Battle of Falkirk. Oh Sir William, can you lead Scotland back into greatness? Can you rise against those who threaten your freedom? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your existance is a threat to our freedom! Prepare to die!
attacked: Your tyranny won't last long, I will make sure of that!
defeated: Another will take my place, you WILL fall.
introduction: I am Sir William Wallace, a knight of the great nation of Scotland.
hateHello: We don't want the likes of you here.
tradeRequest: We require some of your resources, and thus I will exchange some of mine for yours.
uniques: All newly-trained [Land] units [in all cities] receive the [Highlands] promotion

name: Toungoo
startIntroPart1: Bayyinnaung, king of the Toungoo Dynasty of Myanmar from 1550 to 1581. During your 31-year reign, which has been called the 'greatest explosion of human energy ever seen in Burma', You assembled the largest empire in the history of Southeast Asia, which included much of modern-day Myanmar, the Chinese Shan states, Lan Na, Lan Xang, Manipur and Siam. Oh Bayinnaung, we once again require your greatness. Can you create another great empire? Can you become the top of the world? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Hahaha! Your land is now MINE!
attacked: I shall rip you to shreds!
defeated: This is not how it was supposed to go! This is unfair!
introduction: Oh, greetings there stranger!
hateHello: You shall regret whatever you plan on doing.
tradeRequest: Of course, I don't expect you to accept this... But you may prove me wrong.
uniques: [+10]% Production when constructing [All] units [in all cities]

name: Kongo
startIntroPart1: Nzinga a Nkuwu, the 5th ManiKongo of the Kingdom of Kongo between 1470 and 1509. You voluntarily converted to Roman Catholicism and were baptized on 3 May 1491 and took the Christian name of João. Soon after, you abandoned the new faith for a number of reasons, one of them being the Roman Catholic Church's requirement of monogamy. Oh, Nzinga a Nkuwu. Can you rule your kingdom once more? Can you once again strike peace with those stronger than you? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are doomed! I know it!
attacked: The gods- erm- God smite you!
defeated: You- I- No!!!
introduction: Hello, traveller, may I interest you in our local cuisine?
tradeRequest: Hello, what is this 'pasta' you speak of? I want some!
uniques: [+20]% Production when constructing [Culture] buildings [in all cities]

name: Akkad
startIntroPart1: Sargon, also known as Sargon the Great, you were the first ruler of the Akkadian Empire, known for your conquests of the Sumerian city-states in the 24th to 23rd centuries BC. You are have been identified as the first person in recorded history to rule over an empire, a legendary feat. Oh, Sargon. The world needs your greatness once more. Can you rebuild your Great Empire once more? Can you be the first to do a great feat that will immortalize your name for eternity? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I shall carve my empire through yours!
attacked: You can not defeat me! I WILL KILL YOU!
defeated: My Kingdom... My Empire! My Nation! Nooo!
introduction: I am Sargon the Great of the Akkadian Empire, bow before me!
tradeRequest: This is NOT a request, it is an ORDER!

name: Croatia
startIntroPart1: Tomislav, the first king of Croatia. You became Duke of Croatia sometime in 910 and was crowned king in 925, reigning until 928. During your rule, you forged an alliance with the Byzantine Empire against Bulgaria. In the north, Croatia often clashed with the Principality of Hungary; the state retained its borders and, to some extent, expanded with the disintegrated Lower Pannonia. Oh, Tomislav. Can you turn a small nation into a kingdom once again? Can you forge alliances that will leave your nation with great prosperity? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Things have gotten far too rough between us, prepare for war!
attacked: You shall strike first, but ill deal the last blow.
defeated: I... am defeated.
introduction: Who might you be, stranger? I am Tomislav.
tradeRequest: May this trade bring prosperity to us both.
uniques: [+10]% Production when constructing [All] units [in all coastal cities]

name: Xiongnu
startIntroPart1: Midu Chanyu, the creator first emperor of the Empire of Xiongnu. You were the son of Touman and to power by ordering your men to overthrow your father in 209 BCE and successfully unified the tribes of the Mongolian-Manchurian grassland and invaded the Qin Dynasty, severely disrupting and weakening the dynasty for years to come. Oh Modu, can you create a new great empire once more? Can you unite the cities of many into one? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: This is all your fault, I shall call my men into battle!
attacked: You can not defeat me, many have tried and failed!
defeated: Urk... You... Heh... Good work.
introduction: Careful! I nearly mistook you for game!
tradeRequest: Consider this a mutual tribute... Wait that's just called a Trade...

name: The Rashidun
startIntroPart1: Abu Bakr, the first Rashidun Caliph. A close companion and father-in-law of Muhammad, You are referred to with the honorific title al-Siddiq by Sunni Muslims. You were amongst the earliest converts to Islam and propagated dawah to the Mushrikites. You were considered the first Muslim missionary as several companions of Muhammad converted through you. Following Muhammad's death, You succeeded the leadership of the Muslim community as the first caliph. Oh Abu Bakr, the world needs your holiness once more. Can you guide your people to greatness once more? Can you repel the attacks of the non-believers and create a mighty caliphate? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I am very sorry, but this is necesarry.
attacked: Good luck, as Allah is not on your side.
defeated: Congratulations... Please lead my people into greatness and do not let them fall into darkness...
introduction: As-salamu alaykum, I am Abu Bakr. It is very nice to meet you, friend.
tradeRequest: Let us bring prosperity to both of our people, friend.
uniques: Empire enters golden age <after generating a Great Prophet>
[+1 Faith] <in cities following our religion> <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Jerusalem
startIntroPart1: Baldwin IV, the Leper King. You were the king of Jerusalem from 1174 until his death in 1185. Admired by your contemporaries, and later by historians for your willpower and dedication to the Latin Kingdom in the face of debilitating leprosy. Choosing competent advisers, you ruled a thriving crusader state and succeeded in protecting it from the Muslim ruler Saladin. Oh, Baldwin IV, the faith needs you once more. Can you defend against your rampaging enemies? Can you protect your faith from those looking to vanquish it? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: For God!
attacked: I know you will not succeed, but I aplaud you for trying.
defeated: The kingdom of god may have fallen, but not his people.
introduction: I welcome you to my Kingdom, friend.
tradeRequest: God wants this trade to happen, I am sure of it.
uniques: [+3 Gold] <in cities following our religion> <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Seljuk
startIntroPart1: Alp Arslan, the second Sultan of the Seljuk Turks. You greatly expanded the Seljuk territory and consolidated your power, defeating rivals to the south, east and northwest, and your victory over the Byzantines at the Battle of Manzikert, in 1071, ushered in the Turkmen settlement of Anatolia. Oh, Alp Arslan, the world needs you once more. Can you expand your lands to the edges of the world? Can you topple large empires and usurp their throne? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: My empire shall expand to the edges of the world with you on the ground!
attacked: Hah! A futile attempt, you will not defeat me!
defeated: Ahh... My ambitions seem to have lead me to my own bitter end.
introduction: I am Alp Arslan of the Seljuks, we come in peace... For now.
hateHello: Bha! Who let this insolent scum in?!
tradeRequest: Come on now, you know you want this trade.
uniques: Free [Horseman] appears <during the [Classical era]> <upon conquering a city>
Free [Knight] appears <during the [Medieval era]> <upon conquering a city>
Free [Lancer] appears <during the [Renaissance era]> <upon conquering a city>
Free [Cavalry] appears <starting from the [Industrial era]> <upon conquering a city>

name: Khwarazm
startIntroPart1: Ala ad-Din Muhammad, the Shah of the Khwarazmian Empire. You ruled from 1200 to 1220, during which you expanded your empire across Central Asia and Persia, making it one of the most powerful in the region. However, your reign ended in disaster when you mishandled relations with the Mongols by executing their envoys. Genghis Khan swiftly annihilated the Khwarazmian Empire, forcing you to flee and die in exile, marking the rapid collapse of your once-great empire. Oh, Muhammad II, the world now calls for you. Can you fix your mistakes to restore your empire? Can you redeem yourself by expanding your great empire once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You are no use to use anymore, prepare for war!
attacked: You will pay for this insolence! I will see your army burn!
defeated: No! Not again!
introduction: Call me the second Alexander as I will conquer the known world!
hateHello: How dare you come in here unannounced?!
tradeRequest: Diplomacy is the meal that energizes an empire.

name: Brittany
startIntroPart1: Riothamus, King of the Britons. You were active circa AD 470 and fought against the Goths in alliance with the declining Western Roman Empire. You were called 'King of the Britons' by the 6th-century historian Jordanes, but the extent of your realm is unclear. Oh, Riothamus, the world needs you once more. Can you lead your army to victory? Can you establish your nation into the history books? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Fall under my wrath!
attacked: Hmph! I will not tolerate this. No mercy!
defeated: How truly unfortunate...
introduction: Hello stranger, I am the ruler of the lands of Armorica!
tradeRequest: Shall we exchange our resources?
uniques: [+1] Movement <for [All] units> <for [5] turns> <upon declaring war with a major Civilization>

name: Mogadishu
startIntroPart1: Fakhr ad-Din, Sultan of Mogadishu. You expanded the city's trade by forging key ties with regions like Arabia, India, and China. Your reign saw Mogadishu flourish as a cultural and architectural center, with grand buildings reflecting the city’s wealth and status. Through your stable governance and international diplomacy, Mogadishu became a major player in Indian Ocean trade. Oh, Fakhr ad-Din, your people need you once more. Can you strike a deal that will bring great prosperity to your lands once more? Can you manage your intricate diplomacies to prevent your own fall? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: You have failed your people, prepare to die!
attacked: Do not get cocky, I will take down whatever you throw at me!
defeated: At the very least, I went down fighting...
introduction: Greetings, may I interest you in a trade?
hateHello: If you are not here for business, I do not want to hear it!.
tradeRequest: Would you like to trade these resources for the sake of our prosperity?
uniques: [+1 Gold] from [Coast] tiles [in all cities] <after discovering [Currency]>
[+25]% Production when constructing [Water] units <during a Golden Age>

name: Edessa
declaringWar: You have angered me, God, and everything else!
attacked: How dare you?!
defeated: Noo! Ahhh!!!

name: Antioch
declaringWar: In the name of God, Christ, and the Holy Spirit, I SHALL RIP YOU APART!
attacked: YOU INSIGNIFICANT HEATHEN!
defeated: May your woes be many, and your days few.

name: Tripoli
declaringWar: Hahaha! Time for war!
attacked: Hold on a minute!
defeated: I have fallen and I can't get up!

name: San Marino
declaringWar: You can't treat us like this, you shall pay!
attacked: What?! Help!
defeated: You are a monster!
